intro: Ononis subspicata f. villosissima, commonly known as the hairy sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
